text:
We are using tomcat-5.5.15 version on sun solaris with 3.0 red had linux, 64
bit.  We have multiple instances running under tomcat-5.5.15 directory.  The web
application uses jdk1.5.0_06.  After about 2 hours, all instances crash with the
following error output in catalina.out  Any help is appreciated.  Thanks,

#
# An unexpected error has been detected by HotSpot Virtual Machine:
#
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0xb6e99cd1, pid=25382, tid=2368342960
#
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (1.5.0_06-b05 mixed mode)
# Problematic frame:
# V  [libjvm.so+0x3c9cd1]
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as hs_err_pid9204.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp
#

text:
This type of error indicates that either Tomcat or your web-app has tickled a
bug in the JVM itself. This is totally outside the control of any application
developer. Please note the following in your original bug report, and follow it:

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
   http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp
creator: ian988@darwinsys.com
struts_user@anotheria.net
text:
Also the bug is invalid (a JVM HotSpot Bug), here the solution:
http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6346871

Workaround: 
place a file into $TOMCAT_HOME which is named 
.hotspot_compiler
and contains:
exclude org/jacorb/orb/Delegate non_existent

we had the same problem with the request method, so you might want to add this too:
exclude org/jacorb/orb/Delegate non_existent

OR switch to a previous VM Version 1.5_02 should work.
